sentences.cn: …对非天主教徒的不宽容态度。

sentences.en: Don't be intolerant of people whose opinions differ from yours.
sentences.cn: 不要容不得与自己意见不同的人.

sentences.en: He was intolerant of both suggestions and criticisms.
sentences.cn: 他对建议与批评都不能容忍。

sentences.en: Julia said that Francis seemed to be getting intolerant.
sentences.cn: 朱丽娅说,弗朗西斯似乎变得越来越偏狭了.

sentences.en: Many of the desert scrub species that have invaded these ranges are fire intolerant.
sentences.cn: 许多由沙漠侵入这些牧场的灌木种都是耐火的.

sentences.en: people who are intolerant of other people’s political beliefs
sentences.cn: 不能容忍他人政治信仰的人

sentences.en: recipes for people who are gluten intolerant
sentences.cn: 谷蛋白过敏人士的食谱

sentences.en: Several men expressed their abhorrence of this intolerant attitude of Owen's.
sentences.cn: 有些人看到欧文这种叫人难以容忍的态度不禁流露出厌恶的表情.

sentences.en: She’s lactose-intolerant (= unable to drink particular types of milk ).
The electorate became increasingly intolerant of instabilities when the actual rates transgressed those considered tolerable.
sentences.cn: 当实际税率超过可以容忍的限度时,选民们就会越发不能忍受经济的不稳定性.

sentences.en: The manager is intolerant of fools.
sentences.cn: 那位经理不能容忍没头脑的人.

sentences.en: The people have grown intolerant in recent weeks of the King's autocratic ways.
sentences.cn: 最近几周国王的专制行径让民众忍无可忍。

sentences.en: The taxi driver became more and more intolerant of the back - seat driver.
sentences.cn: 出租车司机对那个爱指手画脚步的乘客越来越感到难以容忍.

sentences.en: There was in him the heartiness and intolerant joviality of the prosperous farmer.
sentences.cn: 在他身上有种生意昌隆的农场主常常表现出的春风得意欢天喜地的劲头,叫人消受不了.

sentences.en: They are deeply intolerant of all opposition.
sentences.cn: 他们对所有的反对意见都极为排斥.

sentences.en: They were bitterly intolerant of the opinions of their enemies and the pleasures of their friends.
sentences.cn: 他们对敌人的主张和对朋友的享乐都是绝对不能容忍的.

words.tran_cn: 到难耐的程度；无法忍受地
（尤指对别人的意见）不宽容；偏狭

trans.tran_cn: 不能容忍的，不容异议的，心胸狭窄的
trans.tran_en: If you describe someone as intolerant, you mean that they do not accept behaviour and opinions that are different from their own
